This should be collection cl i.ccrued interest on of where the bonds and coupons done us a matter of protection to the State 1 would a l-< > ncommend that the law governing the plate of pay- ment of bonds and coupons be amended to read that all bonds and coupons owned by the State of Nebraska should be payable at the offloi- of the State Treasurer. With this amendment, no items would be sent out for collection and the securities of the State would be kept intact It as a stiiu- official 1 have achieved auy success. I share Hit honor thereof with those who have been associated with me in my office, to whom f am much indebted for their faithful and efficient services. Respectfully submitted. C. D. ROBINSON.
